item.title: Changelog
item.description:
Customer tailored versions of Obsidian MEDILIG
v0.9.1 2024-08-27
Added
Add/Change patient photo with the click of a button
Modified
Moving media files from media_feeder to patient's assets folder
Simplify the creation of consultation and the linking to the encounter
Fixed doctor list of appointments per week to include only those from the current year
Table paging mechanism when we fetch front-matter data from thousands of patients
Plugins (enable/disable - install/uninstall)
disable
enable only when necessary and for demonstration purposes
Icons (hide/reveal - remove/add)
hide
v0.9.0 2024-07-23
Added
Changed
Fixed All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.
The format is based on Keep a Changelog and this project adheres to Semantic Versioning.Warning The development release of the program, name of the vault, is ObsidianMediligDev.
Pay attention that this release should not be confused with the name of any customer vault. The name of the vault for each customer will change with a unique name e.g. add the name of his company or his surname Each customer will also write his own ToDo list with features that he would like to see implemented Updates/changes should be applied only on Customer's System folder For each new release that is distributed to the customer, include this Changelog and home pages such as Obsidian MEDILIG v0.9.1.en and Obsidian MEDILIG v0.9.1.el that will include the version of Obsidian MEDILIG. Version of Obsidian MEDILIG is now visible in the title of the home page e.g. Obsidian MEDILIG v0.9.1.el for the home page in Greek. The development release of the program, name of the vault, is ObsidianMediligDev Changelog has now been added to describe all notable changes to this project ToDo list has been added to describe important and urgent tasks that will be implemented as well as future plans. Notes folder to create notes independent of the templates automation that handle patient's folder and appointments in Calendar folder A button was added above the photo of a patient to automate the process of changing the photo.
New.Photo.tmpl new templater file is added with the code to handle the movement of the image file from the media_feeder to photo folder.
Patient.Profile.type A button was added above the photo of a patient to automate the process of changing the photo by placing an image at Obsidian MEDILIG media_feeder. The image will be moved and placed under the photo folder that exists in patient's folder.
New.Document.tmpl Code was modified to automate more the process of moving media files from a specific Windows folder, i.e. media_feeder, to patient's assets folder when the button new_document is pressed User will copy any files to the media_feeder and ObsidianMedilig will move them to assets and create the medical document folders inside media_feederare excluded when the movement takes place into assets
Modified Patient.Encounter.type: drop the consultation_link field from frontmatter
Modified vw_patient_encounters.js: the code in current version is updated
Modified vw_doctor_encounters.js: the code in current version is updated
Modified consultation.comp.tmpl: metabind-js-view that binds the consultation filename to the encounter consultation_link field is deleted
Modified patient.encounter.comp.tmpl: change dataviewjs code that displays the consultation date and time with the following: const inlinks = dv.current().file.inlinks; const consPath = inlinks.find(link => link.path.includes("Consultation")).path; const pg = dv.page(consPath) const vdate = dv.func.dateformat(pg.date, "yyyy-MM-dd"); const vdatetime = dv.date(`${vdate}T${pg.startTime}`); const vdatetime_el = vdatetime.setLocale('el').toLocaleString(DateTime.DATETIME_HUGE); dv.paragraph(dv.func.link(consPath, vdatetime_el));
Modified vw_doctor_encounters.js: the code in current version is updated see also above this is the alphabetically sorted list of patients when we press the secretary button
Modified adm20240626210000.admin: the code in current version is updated
Modified vw_patients_sorted_by_family_name.js: the code in current version is updated
Added display_total_patients.js: this JS code file displays total number of patients in a header above the dataview table Plugins that are not essential for the Obsidian Medilig user and that will be disabled in the next release to improve also the startup procedure advanced-tables-obsidian projects annotator auto link titles better word count code styler dialogue emoji toolbar homepage multi properties multi column markdown settings search style settings tag wrangler text format workspaces plus zoom omnisearch Omnisearch is faster and better for searching files but it is causing the following error:Omnisearch: Error while adding "People/Patient/100/mdoc100-1-1.document.md" to live cache Error: Invalid file path: "People/Patient/100/mdoc100-1-1.document.md" when we create medical document by pressing new_document button, it will also try to index documents that are moved inside the assets folder bookmarks templater icon workspace icon Library of medical documents Medication in patient's encounter Table of contents in encounter and clinical case Buttons for quick access of med. history, medication, profile and med. library in encounter and clinical case List of medical documents at the last section of clinical case naming convention of files in folders Patient automatic numbering starts from 100 then auto increments. Clinical case numbering starts with 1 then auto increments Encounter numbering starts with 1 then auto increments Medical document numbering starts with 1 then auto increments Media files numbering start with 1 then auto increments Medical library, current medication, medical history and profile filenames include the patid For a new patient the clinical case must be completed first, then his first encounter. Consecutive encounters always belong to the current, most recent clinical case. When a new patient is created, the profile automatically completes fields hname.first: INCOMPLETE hname.last: INCOMPLETE in case the record, patient folder is left idle without continuing its completion

item.title: ToDo
item.description:
Known Bugs
Patients that are created with the **same name, surname, telephone number**
Content inside patient folder files has `dataview` code and links with wrong filenames
Media files that are moved under patient's assets folder but not renamed
Urgent and Important (Do First)
Not Urgent but Important (Schedule)
Collaborative Simultaneous Work Affects:: There are problems in queries that display patient encounters. That's because of duplicate consultation files that are created automatically based on name_surname_telephone of the patient e.g.2024-06-15 ŒëŒìŒëŒòŒëŒìŒìŒïŒõŒüŒ£_Œ£ŒëŒëŒîŒóŒ£_6991234567 (1)
2024-06-15 ŒëŒìŒëŒòŒëŒìŒìŒïŒõŒüŒ£_Œ£ŒëŒëŒîŒóŒ£_6991234567 (1) 1
Search with Everything for (1) 1.md pattern. A temporary fix is to delete those consultation files with that pattern.Filenames in patient folder are created correctly
But content inside files has dataview code and links with wrong filenames e.g. prfundefined, mhundefined, medundefined, libundefined, prf638.patient
In generating 1036 patients there were 13 patient folders with that problem. This was probably due to the async-await calls that caused racing conditions on how each file is created and modified. The search was done inside VSCode.
The only fix currently is to delete such patient folders
test and check this part of code in New.Document.tmpl// for each new media file modify frontmatter // by adding a new field to capture metadata properties of the media file prevent creating duplicate patients with the same name, surname and telephone test scaling ability, how many patient records-files Obsidian Medilig can handle More tests on having multiple Obsidian programs running and all of them opening and operating on the same Obsidian Medilig vault inside a shared network folder.That method allows multiple users to work simultaneously. Each user can see different things and interact independently on vault files/notes. It is even possible to work on the same note, at the same time.Evidence Current tests showed that this is doable but the client PC that opens the shared vault takes some time e.g. 30sec or more to load plugins and open it

item.title: Pricing Strategy
item.description: Given that your EHR application needs to be downloaded and installed on a device and includes AGPL plugins, there are several considerations and strategies you can adopt for pricing and distribution: Set a Reasonable Fee: Charge a one-time fee for downloading the application. Ensure the fee reflects the value provided by your application while being competitive in the market. Value Proposition: Clearly communicate the benefits of your application, such as comprehensive features, ease of use, and compliance with regulations, to justify the fee. You can charge for related services such as support, customization, updates, or convenient distribution methods. Subscription for Updates and Support: Annual or Monthly Subscription: Offer an optional subscription for ongoing updates, maintenance, and professional support. This can provide a continuous revenue stream and add value for users who need reliable support. Tiered Subscription Levels: Consider different subscription tiers offering various levels of support and additional services, such as premium support, advanced training, or priority feature requests. Bundling Services: Training and Implementation Services: Charge for additional services such as training, implementation support, and customization. These services can be bundled with the initial download fee or offered separately.

item.title: How Obsidian stores data
item.description:
Extract from Obsidian official documentation
Obsidian stores your notes as Markdown-formatted plain text files in a vault. A vault is a folder on your local file system, including any subfolders.Because notes are plain text files, you can use other text editors and file managers to edit and manage notes. Obsidian automatically refreshes your vault to keep up with any external changes.
Obsidian creates an .obsidian configuration folder in the root folder of the vault, which contains preferences specific to that vault, such as hotkeys, themes, and community plugins.Obsidian stores global settings in a system folder. The location of the system folder depends on the operating system you're using. macOS: /Users/yourusername/Library/Application Support/obsidian Windows: %APPDATA%\Obsidian\ Linux: $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/Obsidian/ or ~/.config/Obsidian/ Warning Don't create a vault in the system folder. This may lead to corrupted data or data loss. In order to provide a fast experience while using the app, Obsidian maintains a local record of metadata about the files in your vault called the metadata cache. This metadata powers many things across the app, from the Graph view to the Outline view.Obsidian keeps this cache in sync with the files in your vault, but it is possible for the data to get out of sync with the underlying files. In the event that this happens to your vault, you can rebuild your metadata cache from the app settings in the Files and links section.Windows path: C:\Users\User\AppData\Roaming\obsidian
The initial size of this folder without indexing any Vault is approximately 12MB

item.title: Obsidian Indexing
item.description:
Obsidian uses a system of internal links and metadata to index and organize notes. Here's a brief overview of how Obsidian's indexing works: Markdown files: Obsidian stores all notes as plain text Markdown files. Internal links: Users can create links between notes using double square brackets like this. Obsidian indexes these links to build a network of connected notes. Backlinks: When a note is linked from another note, Obsidian automatically creates a backlink, allowing bidirectional navigation.
Tags: Users can add tags to notes using hashtags #like-this. Obsidian indexes these tags for easy searching and filtering. YAML frontmatter: Metadata can be added to notes using YAML frontmatter at the beginning of files. This allows for custom properties and categorization. Full-text search: Obsidian indexes the content of all notes, enabling quick full-text searches. Graph view: The indexed links and tags are used to generate a visual graph of note connections. Plugins: Obsidian's plugin system allows for extended indexing capabilities, such as dataview for querying note metadata. This indexing system allows for flexible organization and quick retrieval of information within an Obsidian vault.

item.title: Templater Use
item.description:
Templater is a template language that lets you insert variables and functions results into your notes. It will also let you execute JavaScript code manipulating those variables and functions. With Templater, you will be able to create powerful templates to automate manual tasks.To understand how Templater works, let's define a few terms:
A template is a file that contains commands.
A text snippet that starts with an opening alligator bracket <%, ends with a closing alligator bracket %> is what we will call a command. A function is an object that we can invoke inside a command and that returns a value (the replacement string) There are two types of functions you can use:
Internal functions. They are predefined functions that are built within the plugin. As an example, tp.date.now is an internal function that will return the current date.
User functions. Users can define their own functions. They are either system command or user scripts.
Templater defines 2 types of opening alligator brackets, that defines 2 types of commands:
<% %> Interpolation command. It will output the result of the expression that's inside.<%* %> This type of command allows us to execute JavaScript code. With a JavaScript Execution command, we can pretty much do everything that JavaScript allows us to do. Some examples are given below. We can still access the tp object and all the internal variables / functions from this type of command. JavaScript Execution commands let you access global namespace variables. This means you can access things like app or moment.Asynchronous commands Some internal functions are asynchronous. When calling such functions inside a JavaScript execution command, don't forget to use the await keyword if necessary. It is important to note that the tp.system.prompt() and tp.system.suggester() both require a await statement to save the value to a variable Sometimes, you may want to output something when using a JS execution command. When our templating engine generates a replacement string using all of our commands results, it is stored in a variable named tR. This is the string that will contain the processed file content. You are allowed to access that variable from a JS execution command. This means that, to output something from a JS execution command, you just need to append what you want to output to that tR string variable.For example, the following command: <%* tR += "test" %> will output test.We have defined an Obsidian core template to insert a Templater plugin (A)lligator bracket block. The hotkey (Alt + Shift + A) to run the template is using Hotkeys for templates pluginWe have defined an Obsidian core template to insert a Templater plugin alligator star block. The hotkey (Alt + Shift + 8) to run the template is using Hotkeys for templates plugin First we have to go at Settings/Files and links and change the option for the default location for new notes.We want newly created notes to be placed at the same folder as currently open file

This mode is normally used for testing template language code.
It replaces the code in the active file by pressing e.g. Alt+E (execute template language)
and then we can return back to the previous state of the file with the template code by pressing Ctrl + Z (undo command)In this mode we select a template that will be inserted at the cursor point inside an Obsidian note (markdown file) that is already openExtra blank ‚ÄúUntitled‚Äù note created when triggering new template creation This can occur when you create a new note inside a folder based on a specific template or you apply the Create new note from template command and inside the template code you call the function tp.file.create_new One way to avoid this pitfall is to invoke templater with the templater icon or use the Open Insert Template modal command (Alt + I)
You can also define a hotkey to execute the specific template The recommended way to create new note from template is to right click on the folder that we want to create the new note and select the command Create new note from template
Executing this command it will open a pop-up menu with all the templates we have previously defined in the Template folder location setting of Templater plugin. When we select that template, it will try to apply it on the new file that will be created in the specified folder
Another way is to press the shortcut Alt+N when the cursor is on an active note that has been already opened. When we select the template to apply a new note will be created in the same folder with the active note.
We have already seen how to create a new note with Templater plugin by pressing Alt+N. Here we learn another way by creating a New note within a folder. Here we have already configured the Templater plugin with a specific template to apply in that folder. This is the quickest method to create a new note based on a template. Again this can be done in two ways. Either we right-click on the folder and select the command New note
Or we can press hotkey Ctrl+N from inside a currently open file. In either way the template will be applied only if we have configured the Templater plugin with the Folder Templates option
When the Enable Folder Templates option is true templates are triggered when a new empty file is created in a give folder. Templater will try to fill the empty file with the specified template automatically. We must also specify which template will be applied on the specific folder.
